> stupid system of banning players from chatting all because they got reported.

People aren't punished because they were reported. People are punished because of what they said, if others found it offensive, and the chat was reviewed and found to be toxic in nature.

You admit to being warned numerous times with previous punishments, then were surprised when this punishment was vended. All I can do is warn you that this type of behavior is absolutely not tolerated and the next offense will result in a permaban. I hope you take this time to really think about the things you say in-game, and realize there is no reason for them.

It IS possible to get your account back into good standing. All you need to do is kick back, and have a good time playing video games. If you get offended easily, I would suggest making use of the mute feature. Playing with friends can also help to reduce frustration.

My point is that I get toxic because of other players, I played with an unskilled sup player and everyone on the team know that, but the jg didn't care, and he didn't gank bot lane, so I got mad and I waited, but because my lane went bad I couldn't handle him, so I asked him to gank and I said, "shen gank me plz." He didn't gank, so why would I not get mad and get toxic ? All that happened was because of shen not me...... so I'm ask for my account states to get back to normal, and watch me if I get toxic for few days, but not for ever because humans make mistakes and sometimes get toxic.

We've all had games where the actions of the other players made no sense. If you're going to explode about it in chat though then you're going to be permabanned very shortly.

We can't control what happens to us in games or in life, but we can control how we react to them.

A little bit of fair warning, the punishment system takes 3 months of good behaviour for you to go down a punishment tier. So if you step out of line in the next three months, you will be permabanned.
So after 3 months I'll have cleared myself from how they think of me? as a toxic person.... which I'm not really toxic person in life on in other games.

The punishment tiers are this:

* 10-game chat restriction
* 25-game chat restriction
* 2-week ban
* Permaban

By not being toxic for three months, you move from your next punishment being Permaban to it being anther 2-week ban. If you're not punished in the three months after that, the next punishment drops again to a 25-game chat restriction. If your not punished for three months after that, then the next punishment is a 10-game chat restriction. 

That point where your next punishment would be a 10-game chat restriction is when Riot's system considers you not toxic any more, completely reformed, clean slate. That'd be sometime in October.
That make me feel that their system is unforgiving, not cool -_-................. {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

Trust me, in the past players would have to go through multiple punishments and time bans before even getting to a 2-week ban or a permaban. It may seem harsh and unforgiving, but people have to understand that Riot has put their foot down here and are saying that if they're not willing to change their behavior for the better, then they're not welcome here, hence the 4-strike rule in place.

Also, the reason it takes 3 months to drop down a punishment tier is to make sure that the offenders in question are actually making the effort to properly reform and change their behavior for the better. It also helps get the message out that they can't just stop playing the game for a week or a month or two and expect to have a clean slate right away after that; they actually have to put in the actual effort that it takes to reform. If they're not willing to do that, then this game is not for them.

No one's expecting perfection, and that's exactly why the system has built-in leniency for situations like off days and bad games. However, the more and more you act up the more and more leniency you use up until it gets to the point where you don't have any leniency left. If you need to rage then do so at the computer screen rather than in chat. You also did get valid reported several times across multiple games, hence why you were punished.

From [Mini KB: Chat Restrictions](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4533668&page=1#post47204415): 

>**"How did they determine that I was toxic?"**

>As part of the development of Team Builder, Team PB&J built "sophisticated language models to determine the quality of communication. (http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/23ky31/why_is_the_lol_community_so_lazy_that_they_dont/cgyahjq)" Lyte has mentioned on several occasions that they could - and probably would - use those models to detect toxic chat. Given Lyte's penchant for accuracy, it seems likely that the detection system was thoroughly vetted before release.

>From WookieeCookie, (link (http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=47153866#post47153866))

>_The chat restrictions are not based off of the last game you played but rather an investigation of a series of games you've been reported in. Just a few of the things we look at: frequency of games played, frequency of reports received, # of unique players reporting you, types of reports received and so on._

>From Lyte: (link (http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=47282287#post47282287))

>_Secondly, we have a system that's been analyzing millions of chat logs, and become quite good at detecting whether a conversation in a game is negative or positive. I presented some of this work at the previous Game Developer's Conference. It's an interesting system because the more chat logs you feed the system, the more accurate it becomes at determining whether a player communicates more positively or negatively than the average player in League of Legends._

>Keep in mind that Riot will NEVER release details about this detection system, as people would use it to skirt the system.

Also from [Mini KB: Chat Restrictions](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4533668&page=6#post48004373):

>**How do people get chat restrictions after a game where they don't talk or only call timers? Are those people lying?**

>Asked on Reddit by Ryzolryzol (link (http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/27zq5t/chat_restriction_system_based_on_number_of_bans/ci65z9u))

>_Chat restrictions are handed out after the system and Player Support detect a pattern of negative behavior, so it's rarely, rarely for the behaviors you exhibited in your immediate last game. It could be the last 10-20 games, last 40 games, depends on the severity of the behaviors._

From the [Tribunal FAQ](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2411284): 

>**That player in my game was far worse than me. Why am I banned???**
I'll keep this one simple: those other players in your game that you thought were worse are probably also banned. Nearly 100% of the time, those players were banned even before you were. If someone is being toxic, just report them and move on.

>We strongly believe that it is not OK to retaliate. If a player refuses to cooperate and says something negative, then players should ignore the player and report them after the game. Players can ignore or mute players by pressing the “Mute” button on the Scoreboard [when you hit TAB] in the game. 

>If a player retaliates and says something bad back, then the two of you have made a negative experience for potentially the other 8 players in the game. Rarely do teams start working together better when players begin fighting back—great games only happen when players cooperate and don’t make the issues even worse by fighting back and forth.
